Your LaTeX code for GitHub Flavored Markdown (GFM) is:
x=pe−∣∣pe−pp∣∣2(p−pe)∙(pe−pp)(p−pe)x = p_e - \frac{||p_e - p_p||^2}{(p - p_e) \bullet (p_e - p_p)}(p - p_e)x = p_e - \frac{||p_e - p_p||^2}{(p - p_e) \bullet (p_e - p_p)}(p - p_e)
To address your question: Yes, this LaTeX code is correct for GFM. GFM supports LaTeX-style math rendering through MathJax, and your syntax is properly formatted. Here's why:
  • Double dollar signs ($$...$$): These delimit a display math equation in GFM, which will render the equation centered on its own line, exactly as intended here.
  • Norm notation (||...||): You used ||p_e - p_p|| to represent the norm. While in standard LaTeX, the norm is often written with double vertical bars (e.g., \|p_e - p_p\|), MathJax (used by GFM) interprets ||...|| as a norm and renders it appropriately as double bars. This is a common and acceptable practice.
  • Dot product (\bullet): The \bullet symbol for the dot product is standard LaTeX syntax and works perfectly in GFM.
  • Overall structure: The fraction, subscripts, and parentheses are all correctly formatted and will render as expected.
As for your follow-up question, "Did I just forget to mention GFM?": It seems you might be reflecting on whether GFM was specified earlier in a broader context (e.g., an initial problem or conversation). If your original query was about solving an equation mathematically and not about formatting, then mentioning GFM wasn’t necessary at that stage. However, since you’ve now provided this LaTeX code explicitly for GFM, it’s clear you’re focused on formatting it correctly for that platform—and you’ve done so successfully.
Optional Variation
If you prefer to align with stricter LaTeX conventions (though not required for GFM), you could:
  • Use \|...\| instead of ||...|| for the norm: \|p_e - p_p\|.
  • Bold vectors with \mathbf{}: \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{p}_e - .... This would look like:
x=pe−∥pe−pp∥2(p−pe)⋅(pe−pp)(p−pe)\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{p}_e - \frac{\|\mathbf{p}_e - \mathbf{p}_p\|^2}{(\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p}_e) \cdot (\mathbf{p}_e - \mathbf{p}_p)}(\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p}_e)\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{p}_e - \frac{\|\mathbf{p}_e - \mathbf{p}_p\|^2}{(\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p}_e) \cdot (\mathbf{p}_e - \mathbf{p}_p)}(\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{p}_e)
However, since your provided version matches your intended notation and renders correctly in GFM, there’s no need to change it unless you want to adopt this style.
